conclusion: Analyze velocity-time graphs for cars A and B to determine maximum distance when side by side.
At t = 30 seconds, both cars are side by side according to the graph.
At t = 30 seconds, car A is moving at 40 m/s, car B is stationary.
Calculate distance between cars A and B at t = 30 seconds using d = v * t = 40 * 30 = 1200 m.
Distance between cars A and B is constant at 1200 m, thus maximum distance is 1200 m.
The maximum distance between Car A and Car B when side by side is 1200 meters.
